metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8990 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
default-rsyncssh.lua in Lsyncd 2.1.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lsyncd - 2.1.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lsyncd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.5-2').
